meanings.definition: The quality or state of being idiomatic.
meanings.sent1: Her speech had a certain idiomaticness that made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The idiomaticness of his writing made it enjoyable to read.
meanings.sent3: The idiomaticness of the play's dialogue added a touch of authenticity.
meanings.sent4: The idiomaticness of the song lyrics painted a vivid picture in the listener's mind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of idiomaticness in language learning.

meanings.definition: The use of expressions that are natural to a native speaker of a language.
meanings.sent1: His idiomaticness in French made him sound like a local.
meanings.sent2: The idiomaticness of her Spanish was impressive to the native speakers.
meanings.sent3: The idiomaticness of the slang he used made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her idiomaticness in Mandarin was like music to the ears of the locals.
meanings.sent5: The idiomaticness of his accent fooled many into thinking he was a native speaker.
